content.title: Intro
content.content:
1923
Preceded by
1923
1924
Year
1925
Followed by
1925

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1924.

content.title: April
content.content: 14 - Philip Stone, who would voice Théoden in The Lord of the Rings (1978 film), is born.

content.title: May
content.content:
2 - Theodore Bikel, who would voice Aragorn in The Return of the King (1980 film), is born.
? - Actor William Johnson is born.

content.title: July
content.content:
3 - Artist Kay Woollard is born.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien is appointed Professor of English Language at the University of Leeds.
19 - Director Arthur Rankin Jr. is born.
31 - Actor Garard Green is born.

content.title: August
content.content: 8 - Gene Deitch, who would make a short 12 minute adaptation of The Hobbit, is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
1 - Tolkien begins his Professorship.
14 - Philologist Brian Miller, student and friend of J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
25 - Actor Billy Barty is born.

content.title: November
content.content:
6 - Translator William Auld is born.
21 - Christopher Tolkien is born in Leeds, England.

content.title: December
content.content: 23 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

? - Tolkien's poems "An Evening in Tavrobel", "The Lonely Isle", and "The Princess Ní" are published in Leeds University Verse 1914-24.
? - Tolkien tells his son John the story "The Orgog" when he cannot sleep.
Years
1921 1922 1923 1924 1925 1926 1927
